sentence.Network_en: Our interesting teacher could illuminate almost any subject we studied.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们这位有趣的老师几乎能解释清楚我们所学的所有科目.

sentence.Network_en: We illuminate the enemy plane with searchlights in order to shoot at it.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们用探照灯照射敌机为的是向其射击.

sentence.Network_en: They use games and drawings to illuminate their subject.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们用游戏和图画来阐明他们的主题。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin illuminat- 'illuminated', from the verb illuminare, from in- 'upon' + lumen, lumin- 'light'

entry.def: To illuminate something means to shine light on it and to make it brighter and more visible.

example.tran: 这条街上没有照明的路灯。

example.ex: The black sky was illuminated by forked lightning.
example.tran: 叉状的闪电照亮了黑沉沉的天空。

entry.def: If you illuminate something that is unclear or difficult to understand, you make it clearer by explaining it carefully or giving information about it.

example.ex: They use games and drawings to illuminate their subject.
example.tran: 他们用游戏和图画来阐明他们的主题。

sentences.sentence: "This lamp lightens the room a bit"

means.word_mean: 2. make free from confusion or ambiguity; make clear;

sentences.sentence: "Clear up the question of who is at fault"

means.word_mean: 3. add embellishments and paintings to (medieval manuscripts)

auth_sentence.content: We want to inspire people and illuminate their lives.
auth_sentence.res_content: We want to inspire people and illuminate their lives.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We want to inspire people and illuminate their lives.

auth_sentence.content: Powerful searchlights were employed to illuminate the baseball field.
auth_sentence.res_content: Powerful searchlights were employed to illuminate the baseball field.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Powerful searchlights were employed to illuminate the baseball field.

auth_sentence.content: Philip produced an electric flashlight...to illuminate their way.
auth_sentence.res_content: Philip produced an electric flashlight...to illuminate their way.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Philip produced an electric flashlight...to illuminate their way.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表示"使……,成为,进入,再"; 2. 放在同辅音词根前表示"不,无"

stems_affixes.word_buile: il不,无+legible可读的→adj.难读的,难认的
il不,无+liberal宽大的→adj.气量狭窄的,吝啬的
il不,无+licit合法的, 正当的→adj.违法的,违禁的
il不,无+literate有文化的→adj.不识字的
il不,无+logical逻辑的→adj.不合逻辑的
il使……,成为,进入,再+lus玩弄+ion表名词→被[幻觉]玩弄→幻觉
il使……,成为,进入,再+lumin光+ate表动词→使…光明→说明
il使……,成为,进入,再+lustr=lust光+ate表动词→使…光明→说明

sentences.en: A lot of electric lamps illuminated the stage.
The old librarian illuminated some old books and manuscripts.
sentences.cn: 这个老图书馆员把一些古书和旧抄稿加上各种装饰。

sentences.en: Footnotes illuminated the difficult passages of the text.
sentences.cn: 脚注阐明了文中难解的段落。

sentences.en: Our interesting teacher could illuminate almost any subject we studied.
sentences.cn: 我们这位有趣的老师几乎能解释清楚我们所学的所有科目。

jushi.english: We were greatly illuminated by the discussion.
jushi.chinese: 那次讨论使我们受到很大启发。
